column4:
There can be no doubt that socialism is inseparably interwoven with  totalitarianism and the abject worship of the state. Socialism is in its  essence an attack not only upon British enterprise, but upon the right  of the ordinary man or woman to breathe freely without having a harsh,  clumsy tyrannical hand clasped across their mouth and nostrils. (Labour)  would have to fall back on some form of Gestapo, no doubt very humanel
